items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Barle, River Exe, River Lyn, River Mole, River Bray

items.message:
The risk of flooding from the Exmoor Rivers has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. 
Heavy showers are likely to develop during Saturday, easing for a time on Saturday evening. Further heavy showers are expected to move in from the south-west during the early hours of Sunday morning. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: River levels remain high as a result of the heavy, persistent rainfall. Further showery rainfall is forecast later today, 15/02/21, into tomorrow, 16/05/21, and so the flood alert remains in force.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today. Areas most at risk are the Horner Water, Rivers Aller and Washford, and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Visit the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated on Sunday 16/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
The risk of flooding from the Rivers Clyst and Culm has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. 
Heavy showers are likely to develop during Saturday, easing for a time on Saturday evening. Further heavy showers are expected to move in from the south-west during the early hours of Sunday morning. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  

Further showers are forecast today but river levels are not expected to reach the Flood Alert threshold.  We will continue to monitor the situation closely.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.message:
The risk of flooding from the River Exe has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. 
Heavy showers are likely to develop during Saturday, easing for a time on Saturday evening. Further heavy showers are expected to move in from the south-west during the early hours of Sunday morning. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.description: River Dene in South East Warwickshire

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  Further showers is forecast over the next 24 hours.
We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: Langford and Wendlebury Brooks from Stratton Audley down to near Merton

floodArea.riverOrSea: Audley Brook, Langford Brook, Pingle Stream, Bure, Wendlebury Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
We continue to monitor the situation. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Upper River Great Ouse in Northamptonshire, Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire
items.message: River levels have fallen at the Brackley river gauge and have just peaked downstream at Haversham.  Flooding of roads and farmland remain possible today Saturday 15th May. There is a possibility of flooding for the River Great Ouse from Brackley to Haversham, including Padbury Brook. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this stage. Some further rainfall is likely today and over the weekend with isolated heavy showers possible. We expect river levels to rise in response to any further rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated this evening, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have fallen at the Cappenham river gauge following the recent rainfall. Flooding of roads, car parks and farmland remain possible today, Saturday 15th May. There is a possibility of flooding for the River Tove from Towcester to Cosgrove, including Silverstone Brook. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this stage. Some further rainfall is likely today and over the weekend with isolated heavy showers possible. We expect river levels to rise in response to any rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid low lying roads and car parks near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated this evening, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are forecast to continue rising gradually on the River Ray as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today 15/05/21, especially in the Islip area. 
The forecast today is for light widespread showers this morning, followed by isolated rainfall this afternoon which may be heavy at times. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.  River levels are forecast to continue rising gradually on the River Cherwell as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possibletoday, 15/05/2021, especially in the Thrupp and Kings Mill areas. 
The forecast today is for light widespread showers this morning, followed by isolated rainfall this afternoon which may be heavy at times.  
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this evening, 15/05/21, or as the situation changes.
